block.p: Lesley Paula Frieder, the daughter of Deborah and Kenneth H. Frieder of Abington, Pa., is to be married today to Daniel Herman Wolf, a son of Barbara Wolf and Dr. Sheldon M. Wolf of Brentwood, Calif. Rabbi Eliott N. Perlstein is to officiate at the Aldie Mansion in Doylestown, Pa.

The bride, 25, graduated from Yale University and recently completed her second year at the Columbia University School of Law. Next month, she is to become a summer associate at the Boston law firm of Ropes & Gray. Her father is a vice president for business development, in Exton, Pa., for the Bionetics Corporation, a technical consulting company. Her mother is a psychiatric nurse at Abington Memorial Hospital.

Lesley Paula Frieder, the daughter of Deborah and Kenneth H. Frieder of Abington, Pa., is to be married today to Daniel Herman Wolf, a son of Barbara Wolf and Dr. Sheldon M. Wolf of Brentwood, Calif. Rabbi Eliott N. Perlstein is to officiate at the Aldie Mansion in Doylestown, Pa.

The bride, 25, graduated from Yale University and recently completed her second year at the Columbia University School of Law. Next month, she is to become a summer associate at the Boston law firm of Ropes & Gray. Her father is a vice president for business development, in Exton, Pa., for the Bionetics Corporation, a technical consulting company. Her mother is a psychiatric nurse at Abington Memorial Hospital.

The bridegroom, 29, graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and is to receive a Ph.D. in neuroscience tomorrow from Yale. He will go on to complete a medical degree at Yale, which he expects to receive next year. His father is a clinical professor of neurology at the School of Medicine at the University of California at Los Angeles; in December, he retired from Kaiser Hospital in Hollywood, Calif., where he was a neurologist.
